EquidistantTest.cpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002  * \file EquidistantTest.cpp
00003  * \brief Command line utility for azimuthal equidistant and Cassini-Soldner
00004  * projections
00005  *
00006  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010) <charles@karney.com>
00007  * and licensed under the LGPL.  For more information, see
00008  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00009  *
00010  * Compile with -I../include and link with Geodesic.o GeodesicLine.o
00011  * AzimuthalEquidistant.o Gnomonic.o CassiniSoldner.o
00012  *
00013  * See \ref equidistanttest for usage information.
00014  **********************************************************************/
00015 
00016 #include "GeographicLib/Geodesic.hpp"
00017 #include "GeographicLib/AzimuthalEquidistant.hpp"
00018 #include "GeographicLib/CassiniSoldner.hpp"
00019 #include "GeographicLib/Gnomonic.hpp"
00020 #include "GeographicLib/DMS.hpp"
00021 #include <iostream>
00022 #include <sstream>
00023 
00024 int usage(int retval) {
00025   ( retval ? std::cerr : std::cout ) <<
00026 "Usage: EquidistantTest -(c|z|g) lat0 lon0 [-r] [-e a r] [-h]\n\
00027 $Id: EquidistantTest.cpp 6905 2010-12-01 21:28:56Z karney $\n\
00028 \n\
00029 Perform projections based on geodesics.  Convert geodetic coordinates to\n\
00030 either azimuthal equidistant, Cassini-Soldner, or gnomonic coordinates.\n\
00031 The center of the projection (lat0, lon0) is specified by either the -c\n\
00032 option (for Cassini-Soldner), the -z option (for azimuthal equidistant),\n\
00033 or the -g option (for gnomonic).  At least one of these options must be\n\
00034 given (the last one given is used).\n\
00035 \n\
00036 By default, the WGS84 ellipsoid is used.  Specifying \"-e a r\" sets the\n\
00037 equatorial radius of the ellipsoid to \"a\" and the reciprocal flattening\n\
00038 to r.  Setting r = 0 results in a sphere.  Specify r < 0 for a prolate\n\
00039 ellipsoid.\n\
00040 \n\
00041 Geodetic coordinates are provided on standard input as a set of lines\n\
00042 containing (blank separated) latitude and longitude (degrees or DMS).\n\
00043 For each set of geodetic coordinates, the corresponding projected\n\
00044 coordinates x, y (meters) are printed on standard output together with\n\
00045 the azimuth azi (degrees) and reciprocal scale rk.  For Cassini-Soldner,\n\
00046 azi is the bearing of the easting direction and the scale in the easting\n\
00047 direction is 1 and the scale in the northing direction is 1/rk.  For\n\
00048 azimuthal equidistant and gnomonic, azi is the bearing of the radial\n\
00049 direction and the scale in the azimuthal direction is 1/rk.  For\n\
00050 azimuthal equidistant and gnomonic, the scales in the radial direction\n\
00051 are 1 and 1/rk^2, respectively.\n\
00052 \n\
00053 If -r is given the reverse transformation is performed.  x and y are\n\
00054 given on standard input and each line of the standard output gives\n\
00055 latitude, longitude, azi, and rk.\n\
00056 \n\
00057 -h prints this help.\n";
00058   return retval;
00059 }
00060 
00061 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00062   using namespace GeographicLib;
00063   typedef Math::real real;
00064   bool azimuthal = false, cassini = false, gnomonic = false, reverse = false;
00065   real lat0 = 0, lon0 = 0;
00066   real
00067     a = Constants::WGS84_a(),
00068     r = Constants::WGS84_r();
00069   for (int m = 1; m < argc; ++m) {
00070     std::string arg(argv[m]);
00071     if (arg == "-r")
00072       reverse = true;
00073     else if (arg == "-c" || arg == "-z" || arg == "-g") {
00074       cassini = arg == "-c";
00075       azimuthal = arg == "-z";
00076       gnomonic = arg == "-g";
00077       if (m + 2 >= argc) return usage(1);
00078       try {
00079         DMS::DecodeLatLon(std::string(argv[m + 1]), std::string(argv[m + 2]),
00080                           lat0, lon0);
00081       }
00082       catch (const std::exception& e) {
00083         std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of " << arg << ": "
00084                   << e.what() << "\n";
00085         return 1;
00086       }
00087       m += 2;
00088     } else if (arg == "-e") {
00089       if (m + 2 >= argc) return usage(1);
00090       try {
00091         a = DMS::Decode(std::string(argv[m + 1]));
00092         r = DMS::Decode(std::string(argv[m + 2]));
00093       }
00094       catch (const std::exception& e) {
00095         std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of -e: " << e.what() << "\n";
00096         return 1;
00097       }
00098       m += 2;
00099     } else
00100       return usage(arg != "-h");
00101   }
00102 
00103   if (!(azimuthal || cassini || gnomonic)) {
00104     std::cerr
00105       << "Must specify \"-c lat lon\" or \"-z lat lon\" or \"-g lat lon\"\n";
00106     return 1;
00107   }
00108 
00109   const Geodesic geod(a, r);
00110   const CassiniSoldner cs = cassini ?
00111     CassiniSoldner(lat0, lon0, geod) : CassiniSoldner(geod);
00112   const AzimuthalEquidistant az(geod);
00113   const Gnomonic gn(geod);
00114 
00115   std::string s;
00116   int retval = 0;
00117   std::cout << std::fixed;
00118   while (std::getline(std::cin, s)) {
00119     try {
00120       std::istringstream str(s);
00121       real lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk;
00122       std::string stra, strb;
00123       if (!(str >> stra >> strb))
00124         throw GeographicErr("Incomplete input: " + s);
00125       if (reverse) {
00126         x = DMS::Decode(stra);
00127         y = DMS::Decode(strb);
00128       } else
00129         DMS::DecodeLatLon(stra, strb, lat, lon);
00130       std::string strc;
00131       if (str >> strc)
00132         throw GeographicErr("Extraneous input: " + strc);
00133       if (reverse) {
00134         if (cassini)
00135           cs.Reverse(x, y, lat, lon, azi, rk);
00136         else if (azimuthal)
00137           az.Reverse(lat0, lon0, x, y, lat, lon, azi, rk);
00138         else
00139           gn.Reverse(lat0, lon0, x, y, lat, lon, azi, rk);
00140         std::cout << DMS::Encode(lat, 15, DMS::NUMBER) << " "
00141                   << DMS::Encode(lon, 15, DMS::NUMBER) << " "
00142                   << DMS::Encode(azi, 15, DMS::NUMBER) << " "
00143                   << DMS::Encode(rk, 16, DMS::NUMBER) << "\n";
00144       } else {
00145         if (cassini)
00146           cs.Forward(lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk);
00147         else if (azimuthal)
00148           az.Forward(lat0, lon0, lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk);
00149         else
00150           gn.Forward(lat0, lon0, lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk);
00151         std::cout << DMS::Encode(x, 10, DMS::NUMBER) << " "
00152                   << DMS::Encode(y, 10, DMS::NUMBER) << " "
00153                   << DMS::Encode(azi, 15, DMS::NUMBER) << " "
00154                   << DMS::Encode(rk, 16, DMS::NUMBER) << "\n";
00155       }
00156     }
00157     catch (const std::exception& e) {
00158       std::cout << "ERROR: " << e.what() << "\n";
00159       retval = 1;
00160     }
00161   }
00162 
00163   return retval;
00164 }
